noun.description: The outer part of a bird's wing including the flight feathers.

verb.description: Tie or hold the arms or legs of (someone)
examples: he pinioned the limbs of his opponents

verb.description: Cut off the pinion of (a wing or bird) to prevent flight.

origin: Mid 17th century: from French pignon, alteration of obsolete pignol, from Latin pinea pine cone, from pinus pine.
